ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Looking at the African diaspora in different ways and across different times through a book a week. Each person presents one week on a theme (which kind of coincides with chronology of the diaspora) and brings in readings of multiple authors engaged in the topic. Very positive experience

I would recommend it for someone with either an existing background in African History of African American History, as some of the reading topics could be a little challenging for people with an existing background on some of the topics. That being said, the professors do a good job of guiding the discussion to their most fruitful ends.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class exposed me to a much wider historiography than I would have otherwise been exposed to. Additionally, the way the paper was structured, as a deep dive into a particular week's reading, allowed for more specialized consideration of a topic. The class definitely gave me a wider array of knowledge to build on for future scholarship.
